required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CaboCHECK - Cabozantinib in Adult Patients With Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma Following Prior Systemic Check Point Inhibition Therapy: a Retrospective, Non-interventional Study
clinical_study.official_title: Cabozantinib in Adult Patients With Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma Following Prior Systemic Check Point Inhibition Therapy: a Retrospective, Non-interventional Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut für Klinische Krebsforschung IKF GmbH at Krankenhaus Nordwest

clinical_study.source: Institut für Klinische Krebsforschung IKF GmbH at Krankenhaus Nordwest

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-interventional study to retrospectively evaluate the safety and to describe the effectiveness of cabozantinib after immunoncologic treatment with nivolumab or nivolumab plus ipilimumab in routine clinical practice. It consists of a retrospective chart review of patients who have already completed treatment with cabozantinib after nivolumab or nivolumab plus ipilimumab before inclusion.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of serious adverse events at least possibly related to cabozantinib treatment during and up to 30 days after the end of cabozantinib treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: number of terminations of cabozantinib treatment due to adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: number of terminations of cabozantinib treatment due to adverse events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: ORR (investigator assessed; acc. RECIST v1.1 if available)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of cabozantinib treatment in months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of last dose of cabozantinib until the date of first dose of next treatment, assessed up to 100 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time to next treatment in months

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety in IO-cabozantinib-sequence compared to cabozantinib single agent therapy historical data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Safety in IO-cabozantinib-sequence compared to cabozantinib single agent therapy historical data

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of effectiveness endpoints of IO-cabozantinib-sequence to historical efficacy data (ORR, CBR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of effectiveness endpoints of IO-cabozantinib-sequence to historical efficacy data (ORR, CBR)

intervention.description: Retrospective chart review of patients who have already completed treatment with cabozantinib after nivolumab or nivolumab plus ipilimumab before inclusion.

study_pop.textblock: Adults ≥ 18 years with advanced or metastatic renal cell carcinoma (all subtypes) who have completed treatment with nivolumab or nivolumab plus ipilimumab (any line of systemic therapy) directly followed by cabozantinib treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Written informed consent and any locally-required authorization (EU Data Privacy Directive in the EU) obtained from the subject
2. Patients with advanced or metastatic renal cell carcinoma, including all subtypes
3. Age ≥ 18 years
4. Completion of treatment with nivolumab or nivolumab / ipilimumab combination therapy (any line of therapy) directly followed by cabozantinib treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who are unable to consent because they do not understand the nature, significance and implications of the observational trial
2. Involvement in the planning and / or conduct of the study (applies to both Ipsen staff and/or staff of sponsor and study site)

overall_official.affiliation: Institut für Klinische Krebsforschung IKF GmbH at Krankenhaus Nordwest
